did.physloc: Materials may be stored off-site, and may require additional retrieval time. Please contact the Special Collections Research Center for more information.
did.abstract: This collection is comprised of materials produced by the International Brotherhood of Teamsters' International Conventions dating from 1906-2011. The materials include organizational logistics, convention programs, delegate lists, material produced by Convention committees, transcripts of speeches, proceedings for each convention, proposed and adopted Constitutions, and reports.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two series: Convention Organization and Logistics material and Convention Publications

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:
Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository.

Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection is comprised of materials produced by the International Brotherhood of Teamsters' International Conventions dating from 1906-2011. The materials include organizational logistics, convention programs, delegate lists, material produced by Convention committees, transcripts of speeches, proceedings for each convention, proposed and adopted Constitutions, and reports.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, 2012 January 4 [2012.003].

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The International Convention is considered to be the highest deliberative body of the IBT. From its founding in 1903 to 1912 the International Convention was held annually. From 1912 to 1915 it was held every three years. From 1915 to date it is held every five years. Conventions usually run five days during which officers are nominated, committees report out, invited speakers speak and resolutions are passed.

controlaccess.subject: Labor and laboring classes
Labor
Labor unions
Labor unions -- United States -- History -- 20th century

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series comprised of materials produced by the Teamsters' many International Conventions. Included so far are materials from the 20th, 21st and 22nd Conventions, dating from 1969-1982. The materials vary widely in content, including organizational logistics, convention programs, delegate lists, material produced by Convention committees, and transcripts of various speeches.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series is arranged roughly chronologically, following the original order of materials covering the Teamsters' International Conventions.

did.unittitle: Retired International Union Officers and Employees, and Wives of Deceased International Union Officers

28th IBT Convention Ribbons, Agenda, Folder Handouts and 'Convention News' newsletter'

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series is arranged chronologically by the date of each Convention.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is comprised of material published by the IBT's many Conventions. Represented are materials from the IBT's sixth through twenty-seventh conventions (1908-2006), with material from the eigth convention absent. Included are proceedings for each convention, as well as proposed and adopted Constitutions, several reports, and delegate lists.
